subsection_content:
Symptoms of prostatitis vary depending on the condition and cause of inflammation. In general, when prostatitis occurs in men, the patient will have the following signs:
Burning pain when urinating; Difficulty urinating, dribbling, hesitant urination; Frequent urination, nocturia; Feeling of constantly needing to urinate; Cloudy and/or bloody urine; Abdominal pain, groin pain, lower back pain; Pain in the perineum area such as in the middle of the scrotum and rectum; Pain in the penis and testicles; Pain during ejaculation; Muscle aches, chills, fever
Symptoms of prostatitis
